availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Curry on July 31, 1853. Father of William Curry, Malinda Curry, Samuel Curry, and Elijah Curry. Farmer in Adair County in 1850 and in 1860. Mustered into service as a captain in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on December 23, 1863. Mustered out of service on January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District no. 2, p. 87. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 21-22. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 369. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 124. Curry (1833-1865?)," Memorial #67243667, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67243667 (accessed October 6, 2018).
